intro: Kotschya carsonii f. multifoliolata, commonly known as the Carson's kotschya, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, lobed leaves that are often clustered at the base of the plant. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring, adding a subtle visual appeal. Its foliage is typically covered in a fine layer of white, waxy hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. This subspecies is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
